intro: Carex acuta f. rigida, commonly known as rigid spike sedge, is a variant of the common spike sedge, characterized by its stiff, upright leaves. It is a perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The plant produces dense, cylindrical spikes of small, greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is typically dark green and has a grass-like appearance, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It is relatively low maintenance and thrives in partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens or wetland areas.
